page.title: 04Houses in Rolvenden
page.content: There are about 600 dwellings in the parish of{Rolvenden.}About one third of these were built by Tenterden Rural District Council and are now owned by Ashford Borough Council. The remainder are privately owned. Most of the old houses were built in the 18th & early 19th centuries. This is because almost all of the houses in the village were burned down about 300 years ago, following the Great Plague. The inhabitants moved to Lain Green, which became{Rolvenden Layne. } Houses in the area are expensive to buy. A 2-bedroomed cottage in a terrace costs between Â£35,000 and Â£50,000, while a 4-bedroomed detached house costs between Â£65,000 & Â£95,000. In the 1960's there was a special housing development at Monypenny with sheltered housing for old people. More old people live here than 10 years ago
